intro: Rutidea lomamiensis, commonly known as the Lomami legume, is a flowering plant species native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its compound leaves and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow or green. Rutidea lomamiensis is typically found in moist, tropical forest environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
